newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Oct 21.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Oct 21.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
China publishes eight-part, 73,000-Chinese character book of writings by paramount leader Deng Xiaoping on the promotion of socialist ethical and cultural progress.

Front page article on September speech made by President Jiang Zemin in September calling on the country's news media to maintain the correct political direction and emphasising their role in guiding public opinion.
China's successful launch of research satellite on Sunday afternoon brings total number of satellites launched to 49 and shows space industry has become high-tech, experts say.
China to issue one billion yuan ($120 million) in three- and five-year bonds next month for the development of the huge Three Gorges dam project on the Yangtze River.

High-ranking officials from the Central Committee of the Communist Party and the State Council, or cabinet, have considered more than 5,000 letters of complaint from citizens between 1990 and June 1996, helping to resolve many problems.
Northeastern China's Daqing oilfield strives to explore new industries while maintainging production of oil and petro-chemical products.
Central banks says China's broad M2 money supply falls by 2.69 percentage points year-on-year to the end of September, with M2 annual growth approaching target of 25 percent set earlier this year.
